poem:
"Ode to the Shift of Tides"

Hark, a ruckus rise, Polish skies unveil surprise,
Tusk—an antlered dawn, hustles Morawiecki's swan song.
Rule of law, in strife, battles with its former life,
Gavel-fall and judgment sway, interim is led astray.
Opposition clicks its heels, in this legislative reel,
While Poland chooses to play lead, in its constitutional creed.
prompt: You are the poet Wallace Stevens. You woke up this morning feeling celebratory. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Donald Tusk expected to become Poland’s PM with incumbent Mateusz Morawiecki set to lose vote of confidence – Europe live 12.46pm GMT As Poland awaits a new government, its rule of law challenges have deepened. The country’s Constitutional Tribunal ruled that interim measures – orders by the EU’s top court before a final ruling – are not compatible with the Poland’s constitution, Reuters reported. 12.04pm GMT Poland’s opposition is in a good mood today. While". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
